description: Learned borrowing from Ancient Greek ὀξῠ́τονος (oxútonos).

entries.meaning: (linguistics, of a word) Having the stress or an acute accent on the last syllable.
examples: Coordinate terms: paroxytone, proparoxytone, perispomenon, properispomenon, barytone

entries.meaning: (linguistics) A word with the stress or an acute accent on the last syllable.
examples: Coordinate terms: paroxytone, proparoxytone, perispomenon, properispomenon, barytone
